text: Ananta Charan Sukla (6 November 1942 â€“ 1 October 2020) was an Indian educator, philosopher and historian. He was a professor of English and Comparative Literature at Sambalpur University. He was born in Odisha, India. Sukla was the founding editor of the international half-yearly Journal of Comparative Literature and Aesthetics. Sukla died on 1 October 2020 in Odisha from multiple organ failure at the age of 77. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:Indian educators Category:Indian historians Category:Indian philosophers
title: Ananta Charan Sukla
